content:
No, non c'è una opzione specifica per questo.

Si può personalizzare l'aspetto di Thunderbird modificando un file denominato userChrome.css ma bisogna andare a tentativi e cercare sul web un codice che esegue esattamente la modifica desiderata. Inoltre questo genere di modifica non è ufficialmente supportata -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/userChromecss-userChromejs-userContentcss-non-supportati

creator: Firefox2819

content: That message is telling you that servers are not able to confirm that you are really you. That is, you might be sending email from jane@xyz.com, yet you're sending email from smtp.yahoo.com. The receiving server looks at yahoo to see if it confirms that your account is there. The SPF and DKIM settings are settings that the email provider does (not you) to confirm the relationship. I encourage you to notify your email provider of the messages and to make the correction.
creator: davidsk

content: Suggestions are always welcome. We are just volunteers here to assist in the use of Thunderbird, nothing else. We don't vote, we don't make decisions. If you wish to have those in higher positions to see your suggestion, I encourage you to go to connect.mozilla.org and post your suggestion in the IDEAS section. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: Suggestion: since you are one of our donors (thank you), you may wish to turn off the request for donations that appears when Thunderbird starts. You can do that at settings>general and untick the option to display the start page.
creator: davidsk

creator: michaelmuller

content: There is a free Windows utility for this at https://www.nirsoft.net/utils/web_browser_password.html Your antivirus may not like it, so you may have to set an exception for it to run, but I've used it for years. The program can do Firefox passwords and also Thunderbird users and passwords. This is a personal reference and not an official Mozilla recommendation.
creator: davidsk

content: If you need to change your email password, you need to go to your email provider's online web login and change it there. Then, the next time you run Thunderbird, it should report incorrect password and prompt for the new one.
creator: davidsk

content:
Ugh, just realized I asked this question a year ago, please ignore the spam + junk part of the post.

Would still like to have an "empty spam folder" option in the pulldown menu.
creator: etta.koenig

content: Although I'm just a volunteer, my guess is that won't happen because it's not a standard folder in Thunderbird. If this is an IMAP account and your email provider places spam there on receipt, you could set the folder to be checked when checking for new mail and create a filter to move it to the Junk filter.
creator: davidsk
